Package template

Class Util

  • java.lang.Object
    • template.Util
  • public class Util
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class, supporting the project with several static methods and constants.

    • Method Detail

      • appendColumns

        public static void appendColumns​(java.lang.StringBuilder sb,
                                 java.lang.String text,
                                 int index,
                                 int nrOfcolumns,
                                 java.lang.String speparator,
                                 int minColLength)
        Appends a newline or the separator string before appending the text, depending on the index and nrOfcolumns.
        Use: to write lists and add newlines if lines get too long.
        Parameters:
        sb - a StringBuilder to store the text items
        text - the text to append
        index - the index, usually taken from a for() loop
        nrOfcolumns - the number of columns of a line
        speparator - a string separating the columns
        minColLength - a text of a length less than minColLength will be extended to minColLength using the space character

      • createDateAndTimeStamp

        public static java.lang.String createDateAndTimeStamp()
        Creates a date and time stamp (without milliseconds) as a String.
        Returns:
        the time stamp string

      • createStringOf

        public static java.lang.String createStringOf​(int count,
                                              java.lang.String s)
        Creates a string by repeating another string, which may be a single character. Example: createStringOf(50, "*");
        Parameters:
        count - the number of repeating
        s - the string to be repeated
        Returns:
        the repeated result string

      • prompt

        public static java.lang.String prompt​(java.lang.String text)
        Prompts for a text message in the System.out window, blocks until the user types RETURN/ENTER and returns the string typed in. This method intentionally encapsulates possible exceptions.
        Parameters:
        text - the text string to be displayed
        Returns:
        a String containing the input

      • readFileIntoString

        public static java.lang.String readFileIntoString​(java.lang.String inputFileName,
                                                  int charBufferSize)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Reads an input file into a String object.
        Parameters:
        inputFileName -
        charBufferSize - the size of a (very large) temporary input buffer
        Returns:
        a string containing the contents of the whole input file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on errors reading the input file

      • readFromUrl

        public static java.lang.String readFromUrl​(java.lang.String urlString)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads the contents of an URL into a String object.
        Note: this is a very simple wget.
        Parameters:
        urlString - the URL to read from
        Returns:
        the contents of the URL
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • renameToBackupFile

        public static void renameToBackupFile​(java.lang.String filename,
                                      java.lang.String backupFilename)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Renames a file to a backup file, if the file exists . If an old backup file exists already, it will be deleted before renaming the file.
        Parameters:
        filename -
        backupFilename -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • sleep

        public static void sleep​(long millis)
        Convenience method for Thread.sleep(millis).
        Note: the thread calling this method will sleep, a (unlikely) happening InterruptedException is ignored, but the stack trace is printed.
        Parameters:
        millis - the milliseconds to sleep

      • stackTraceToString

        Returns the stack trace of an Exception as a string.
        Parameters:
        e - the Exception
        Returns:
        the stack trace as String

      • stringParam

        public static java.lang.String stringParam​(java.lang.String string,
                                           java.lang.Object... args)
        Replaces parameter arguments of "$(N)" in a string and returns the result. Note: N has to be an integer and counts from one to N. 
        
 Example:
   String s = stringParam("I can feel $(2) disturbance in the $(1)", "force", 1);
   results in "I can feel 1 disturbance in the force".
        Parameters:
        string - the string (with 0..N parameters)
        args - a bunch of arguments (...), 0..N replacement objects
        Returns:
        the replaced result string

      • toLength

        public static java.lang.String toLength​(java.lang.String text,
                                        int length)
        Expands a String object to a given length, either by cutting the string or by extending it with spaces.
        Use: create output with fix-sized columns.
        Parameters:
        text -
        length - length to expand or cut
        Returns:
        the resulting string

        Returns:
        a string of %
